name: Owl's Head Skatepark
description: Well-built concrete skatepark in Owl's Head Park with harbor views. One of Brooklyn's best skateparks featuring both transition and street elements.
history: Opened around 2013, designed with significant community skater input. The park filled a gap in southern Brooklyn's skate infrastructure and quickly built a dedicated local scene. The Bay Ridge community has been supportive of the park.
bestTimes: Mornings for a chill session. Weekends get packed, especially in good weather. The harbor breeze keeps summer sessions bearable.
transitDirections: R to Bay Ridge Ave, walk west toward the water. The park is in Owl's Head Park along Shore Road, overlooking the Narrows.

detailedNotes.terrain: Concrete bowl with pool coping, a snake run connecting elements, street-style ledges and rails section. Good flow throughout. The surface is well-maintained.
detailedNotes.culture: Strong local crew, very welcoming to visitors. The Bay Ridge scene is tight-knit. Parents bring kids on weekend mornings — respect the flow.
detailedNotes.warnings: Can be windy due to waterfront location. The bowl collects water after rain — bring a broom. Parking available nearby.
